raw.title: [BIP-747] Enable USDX/USDT and sUSDX/USDX gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1603

## Summary

This is a proposal to enable Balancer gauges on Arbitrum for USDX/USDT and sUSDX/USDX pools.

## References/Useful LInks

Link to:

* Website: https://usdx.money/

* Documentation: https://docs.usdx.money/

* Github Page: [USDX Token · GitHub](https://github.com/USDXToken)

* Communities: [X](https://x.com/usdx_money), [Telegram](https://t.me/USDX_Community), [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/usdxmoney)

## Protocol Description

* usdx.money is a stablecoin infrastructure project, with USDX as its first product.

* USDX is a synthetic stablecoin, designed to offer a stable, censorship-resistant, crypto-native money. USDX captures yield from crypto-native sources and distributes it back to its users.

* sUSDX is a staked version of USDX; yield for sUSDX currently stands around 19%.

* USDT is a fiat-backed USD-denominated stablecoin, issued by Tether.

## Motivation

* usdx.money has recently launched its points campaign, and expects the TVL to rapidly increase. With increased TVL, usdx.money is committed to building robust liquidity for sUSDX/USDX and USDX/USDT pairs on Arbitrum Chain to facilitate secondary liquidity for USDX and sUSDX. We are seeking to bootstrap majority of our liquidity on Balancer, and this will help onboard more users to both usdx.money and Balancer.

## Specification

1. **Governance**: currently owned by 0x3f9a06aD4c83c289DF83461fE5F24EE4c4491935 (3 out of 4 multisig).

2. **Oracles**: The protocol does not reply on external oracles.

3. **Audits**: [link](https://1166152427-files.gitbook.io/~/files/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces%2F5mdBNVoaU0Rn0IEZP0Y1%2Fuploads%2FAGLbaiVubfT1xuY1FdmH%2FBlocksec_Security_Audit_Report_for_USDX.pdf?alt=media&token=6326b906-c1b4-49cd-b670-666baee5d030). Additional audit reports can be viewed on https://docs.usdx.money/informaiton/audit

4. **Centralization vectors**: The centralization vectors primarily relate to the owner of the contracts, which is a 3 out of 4 multisig. The team has 15 full-time, doxxed contributors.

5. **Market history**: USDX has not previously de-pegged, and sUSDX is an ERC4626 token. Balancer pools for USDX/USDT and sUSDX/USDX have just been deployed.

* Addresses for USDX/USUSDT

  * Pool address: https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0x85564af67760063b994599b640552614238c9ee60000000000000000000005e3

  * Arbitrum Child Gauge: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7bbD2B8932610dEC2698C63fC28130224A339Df2#readContract

  * Mainnet Root Gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x5f244e8ac0FF2d2af14368fd8EFd1E508a50CF68
* Addresses for sUSDX/USDX

  * Pool address: https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0xb3047330c1cb5eb1a3670fabfb99bdc106d631eb0000000000000000000005e4

  * Arbitrum Child Gauge: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x83bE87529aC31d06fEc49FF5Aedd6290b81D0700

  * Mainnet Root Gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x0d1b58fB1fC10F2160178DE1eAE2d520335ee372

6. **Value**: USDX currently has $210m in TVL, making it the th largest protocol by TVL on [BNB Chain](https://defillama.com/chain/BSC). As the protocol rolls out points program on Arbitrum, we intend for Balancer pools to be the primary source of liquidity for USDX and sUSDX on Arbitrum.

### Technical Specification
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments: gauge(address):`0x5f244e8ac0FF2d2af14368fd8EFd1E508a50CF68` gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum` gauge(address):`0x0d1b58fB1fC10F2160178DE1eAE2d520335ee372` gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-699] Enable a wstETH/GYD gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1358

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Arbitrum for a wstETH/GYD E-CLP. 

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* wstETH is a static wrapper of stETH. stETH is a yield bearing token that represents staked ether in [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5230610-what-is-steth).


**Motivation**

> Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools. The calibration was improved over the previously deployed, equivalent pool that was whitelisted [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-691-enable-gauge-for-gyd-wsteth-e-clp-arbitrum/5956).

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * ‘rateProvider0’: wstETH rate provider on Arbitrum: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836)
and relevant [review ](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wstethRateProvider.md).
> *  ‘rateProvider1’: GYD rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x72F6Da3b4bd0Ab7028F52339Ee3B1f94fffe2dD0](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x72F6Da3b4bd0Ab7028F52339Ee3B1f94fffe2dD0).
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** n/a.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the token(s). 

#### Contracts

> * E-CLP: [0x6ce1D1e46548ef657f8D7Ebddfc4BEaDB04F72f3](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x6ce1D1e46548ef657f8D7Ebddfc4BEaDB04F72f3)
>* Child gauge on Arbitrum: [0x654a17A779B82BA7739cD3Adb2052e039c4366C5](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x654a17A779B82BA7739cD3Adb2052e039c4366C5)
>* Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C)

#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0x9E965252d1b294aF358a232933A65Bd30645c34C`
>gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-724] Enable GYD/aUSDT gauge [Polygon PoS]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1438

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge on Polygon PoS for a GYD/aUSDT E-CLP. 

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated meta-stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* USDT is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Tether](https://tether.to/en/). aUSDT is the yield-bearing deposit receipt token for lending out USDT on Aave, in a static wrapper.


**Motivation**

> GYD is launching on Polygon PoS. This is a core pool to enable initial liquidity.

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * ‘rateProvider0’: [0x9977a61a6aa950044d4dcD8aA0cAb76F84ea5aCd](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x9977a61a6aa950044d4dcD8aA0cAb76F84ea5aCd) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/statATokenLMRateProvider.md)
> *  ‘rateProvider1’: 0x00
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** This is the first GYD pool on Polygon PoS.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to better match the historic prices and low volatility of the included tokens. 

#### Contracts

> * E-CLP: [0xa8CbbfFE0d62797AFAF7af0A23810bd5ba39a4dD](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xa8CbbfFE0d62797AFAF7af0A23810bd5ba39a4dD)
>* Child Gauge on Polygon: [0xCC322077D4056739FC11E950326b2a97aEcB0cc8](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xCC322077D4056739FC11E950326b2a97aEcB0cc8)
>* Root Gauge on Ethereum: [0x8E4debFB047eFCF6501665160739818E90eD621F](https://etherscan.io/address/0x8E4debFB047eFCF6501665160739818E90eD621F)


#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0x8E4debFB047eFCF6501665160739818E90eD621F`
>gaugeType(string): `Polygon`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-723] Enable two E-CLP gauges [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1437

**Summary**
> This is a proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges on Gnosis Chain for (1) a GYD/aUSDC.e Rehype Pool and (2) a GYD/sDAI E-CLP.

**References/Useful links**

> Links
> * [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
> * [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
> * [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
> * [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
> * [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

**Protocol Description**

>* GYD is a USD denominated meta-stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
>* USDC.e is the bridged version of a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/usdc). aUSDC.e is the yield-bearing deposit receipt token for lending out USDC.e on Aave, in a static wrapper. 
> * sDAI is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [MakerDAO](https://makerdao.com/en/), staked to earn yield.


**Motivation**

> GYD is launching on Gnosis Chain. These are two core pools to enable initial liquidity.

**Specification**
 
>1. **Governance:** The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.
>
>
>2. **Oracles:** 
> * GYD/aUSDC.e
>   * ‘rateProvider0’: 0x00
>   *  ‘rateProvider1’: [0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x5F62fd24941B585b91EB059E0ea1a7e729357511) (and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/statATokenLMRateProvider.md))
> * GYD/sDAI
>   * ‘rateProvider0’: [0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x89C80A4540A00b5270347E02e2E144c71da2EceD) (and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/SavingsDAIRateProviderGnosis.md))
>   *  ‘rateProvider1’: 0x00
>
>3. **Audits:** Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.
>
>4. **Centralization vectors:** No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.
>
>5. **Market History:** These are the first GYD pools on Gnosis Chain.
>
>6. **Value:** This pool is intended to better match the historic prices and low volatility of the included tokens. 

#### Contracts

> * GYD/aUSDC.e 
>   * E-CLP: [0x263A6Edafa6444DC2ae550f9EFF6344c1686d6aA](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x263A6Edafa6444DC2ae550f9EFF6344c1686d6aA)
>   * Child Gauge: [0xeCC38A7E4EB20FB72BA1cDcF2fC7A6002C6C59f3](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xeCC38A7E4EB20FB72BA1cDcF2fC7A6002C6C59f3)
>   * Root Gauge: [0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b](https://etherscan.io/address/0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b)
>
> * GYD/sDAI 
>   * E-CLP: [0x1e8b447129984d8A6B652C807DfC3bd135973133](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x1e8b447129984d8A6B652C807DfC3bd135973133)
>   * Child Gauge: [0xEA71b7FDAA3683D2d307e8AF3e236FB7a395e88d](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xEA71b7FDAA3683D2d307e8AF3e236FB7a395e88d)
>   * Root Gauge: [0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3)


#### Specification


>Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function twice with the following arguments:
>
>gauge(address): `0xFa2F6BE7cF4da6FaE6A011A4EFC53180c9Cf0a1b`
>gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`
>
>gauge(address): `0xe2251F5cc98f8Ccd8812Be9c0aAe8A9bD29500F3`
>gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-691] Enable gauge for GYD/wstETH E-CLP [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR With Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1312

### Summary

This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauges on Arbitrum for a GYD/wstETH E-CLP. We propose to only enable protocol fees of 50% once BAL rewards start. Initially, the entire protocol fee revenue will accrue to Balancer.

### References/Useful links

* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description

* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/).
* wstETH is a static wrapper of stETH. stETH is a yield bearing token that represents staked ether in [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5230610-what-is-steth).

---

### Motivation

Gyroscope is launching further strategic pools.

---

### Specifications

#### Governance

The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

#### Oracles
* ‘rateProvider0 for wstETH’: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26b574063e7b098ed74fad6779e65e3f836#code) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wstethRateProvider.md).
* ‘rateProvider0’ for GYD: [0x3a216B01db971Bf28D171C9dA44Cc8C89867697F](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x3a216B01db971Bf28D171C9dA44Cc8C89867697F)


#### Audits

Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors

No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History

* The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
* This is the first GYD/ wstETH pool.

## Value

As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
* E-CLP: [0x596a76a1AE4F7a6055F0C7D4e40737bFc19cFa2c](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x596a76a1AE4F7a6055F0C7D4e40737bFc19cFa2c)
* Child gauge on Arbitrum: [0x44Ab430eFDFf0b6f467f2148a90DC9A8F0ab8D67](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x44Ab430eFDFf0b6f467f2148a90DC9A8F0ab8D67)
* Arbitrum root gauge on Ethereum: [0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e](https://etherscan.io/address/0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e)

---

Specification

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the gaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd `and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

* gauge(address): `0xC11442Cdbe8901b36aeB7bE7F3f95B6a8ade394e`
* gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: This proposal seeks to enable the Balancer gauge on Arbitrum for the sUSDX/USDX/aUSDT pool, aiming to enhance liquidity and yield opportunities for users in this stablecoin pool.
key_arguments_for: The proposal enables a gauge on Arbitrum for a high-value stablecoin pool with strong liquidity and yield potential.
Previous similar proposals enabling gauges on Arbitrum and Ethereum were successful and resulted in increased TVL despite some price fluctuations.
Timeline metrics show strong early and consistent support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option with high voting power backing this choice.
key_arguments_against: One forum comment expressed concerns, reflected in a negative sentiment classification, indicating some community reservations.
Market impacts show a slight decline in price and TVL post-event, suggesting potential risk or uncertainty with the change.

evidence.quote: Two comments: first is a detailed PR with payload explaining the proposal; second is a neutral post linking to the snapshot proposal.
Timeline shows 5 voters, strong early and consistent lead for 'Yes, let's do it' with 100% lead ratio in most quartiles.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The timeline analysis shows strong and stable early support for enabling the gauge, indicating community readiness for this change.
- Forum sentiment is mixed with one negative and one neutral comment, but overall voting power overwhelmingly supports the proposal.
- Historical adjacent proposals enabling similar gauges on Arbitrum and Ethereum were passed with strong support, leading to increased TVL despite some price volatility, suggesting the change can be beneficial long-term.
- Market impacts show slight declines in price and TVL post-event, signaling some risks; however, these do not outweigh the benefits of increased liquidity and yield opportunities provided by the gauge.
- The recommendation aligns with the leading vote and is consistent with past successful implementations, although forum sentiment shows some caution; overall, the vote reflects community views sufficiently to endorse the change.
